answers.answer: I didn't think my feet looked swelled, but my cowboy boots are getting tight, I had to switch to a thinner sock.  That's all I really wear, but each boot is too tight!  Oh boy, the things we have to look forward to even later on!

I work from home, so half the time I dont' wear shoes, probaby about 75% of the time.  I did notice, however, that one particular sandle I wear was a bit snug on me.My pregnancy nurse that calls me each month says to drink 8 glasses of water a day.  This keeps swelling away.
Thanks ladies I was really worried that it was me but now I see it is I guess normal. My dt apt isn't til next week but I'll be sure to ask.
I have noticed that if I have been sitting a lot with my legs down or walking a lot my shoes get tight.

my boobs have swelled :)other than that, i just noticed today that it's very hard to get my engagement ring off. guess it's going to be put away until next fall :(swelling makes me nervous. I know some swelling is normal, but since i ended up with preeclampsia I don't like that my fingers are fat despite not gaining a pound.

question: Has anyone else started feeling that thier shoes are too tight? I think it is too soon but I already don't fit in half of my shoes and my feet look like tamales and I mean the big ones.
title: SWELLING????
